title: [FR] Show only relevant columns

labels.name: area/uiux
labels.description: Front-end, user experience, plotting, JavaScript, JavaScript dev server

body:
### Willingness to contribute

No. I cannot contribute this feature at this time.

### Proposal Summary

1) Show only columns which have values at least for one of the currently displayed (selected/filtered) runs
2) Show only columns with more than one unique value for the currently displayed runs
3) Remember user's selection of columns and don't show all the columns again as soon as another run starts or the user leaves the page to open one of the runs or compares them etc.

### Motivation

> #### What is the use case for this feature?
Over time, lots of parameters and metrics are collected within an experiment, some of them become irrelevant, others are still important but you want to see the essential in the list

> #### Why is this use case valuable to support for MLflow users in general?

> #### Why is this use case valuable to support for your project(s) or organization?

> #### Why is it currently difficult to achieve this use case?
Currently, even after you've tediously selected the columns, whenever a new run starts or you leave the page and then come back, all 100 columns are displayed again. This is the biggest drawback of mlflow, which is otherwise great!

### Details

_No response_
